ListItem.title: Limited to parietal pleura without involvement of ipsilateral visceral, mediastinal, or diaphragmatic pleura

ListItem.name: LI_45073
ListItem.title: Limited to parietal pleura with focal involvement of ipsilateral visceral, mediastinal, or diaphragmatic pleura

ListItem.name: LI_358173

ListItem.title: Ipsilateral mediastinal (including internal mammary, peridiaphragmatic, pericardial fat pad, or intercostal nodes)

ListItem.name: LI_379912
ListItem.title: Contralateral mediastinal (including internal mammary, peridiaphragmatic, pericardial fat pad, or intercostal nodes)

Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Section.name: S_5858
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note H)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43158
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_43158_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_327897
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_5861
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_59456
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor limited to the ipsilateral parietal pleura with or without involvement of: visceral pleura; mediastinal pleura; diaphragmatic pleura

ListItem.name: LI_5865
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor involving each of the ipsilateral pleural surfaces (parietal, mediastinal, diaphragmatic, and visceral pleura) with at least one of the following features: involvement of diaphragmatic muscle; extension of tumor from visceral pleura into the underlying pulmonary parenchyma

ListItem.name: LI_5866
ListItem.title: pT3: Describes locally advanced but potentially resectable tumor. Tumor involving all of the ipsilateral pleural surfaces (parietal, mediastinal, diaphragmatic, and visceral pleura), with at least one of the following features: involvement of the endothoracic fascia; extension into mediastinal fat; solitary completely resectable focus of tumor extending into the soft tissues of the chest wall; nontransmural involvement of the pericardium

ListItem.name: LI_5867
ListItem.title: pT4: Describes locally advanced technically unresectable tumor. Tumor involving all of the ipsilateral pleural surfaces (parietal, mediastinal, diaphragmatic, and visceral pleura), with at least one of the following features: diffuse extension or multifocal masses of tumor in the chest wall, with or without associated rib destruction; direct transdiaphragmatic extension of tumor to the peritoneum; direct extension of tumor to the contralateral pleura; direct extension of tumor to mediastinal organs; direct extension of tumor into the spine; tumor extending through to the internal surface of the pericardium with or without a pericardial effusion, or tumor involving the myocardium

ListItem.name: LI_327898
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327899
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_5870
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastases

ListItem.name: LI_50471
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastases in the ipsilateral bronchopulmonary, hilar, or mediastinal (including the internal mammary, peridiaphragmatic, pericardial fat pad, or intercostal) lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_53803
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastases in the contralateral mediastinal, ipsilateral, or contralateral supraclavicular lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_5877
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_5877_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

ListItem.name: LI_5895
ListItem.title: Pulmonary interstitial fibrosis (specify pattern if discernable)

Question.name: Q_379916
Question.title: Other Ancillary Studies (specify types and results)
